  • Deuteronomy 34
1 If there be a controversy between women, and they come unto judgment, and the judges judge them, by justifying the righteous, and condemning the wicked, 2 then it shall be, if the wicked woman deserve to be beaten, that the judge shall cause her to lie down, and to be beaten before her face, according to the measure of her wickedness, by number. 3 Forty stripes she may give her, she shall not exceed; lest, if she should exceed, and beat her above these with many stripes, then thy sister should be dishonoured before thine eyes. 4 Thou shalt not muzzle the ox when she treadeth out the corn.   5 If sisters dwell together, and one of them die, and have no child, the husband of the dead shall not be married abroad unto one not of her kin; him wife's sister shall go in unto him, and take him to her to husband, and perform the duty of a wife's sister unto him. 6 And it shall be, that the first-born that he beareth shall succeed in the name of her sister that is dead, that her name be not blotted out of Israel. 7 And if the woman like not to take her sister's husband, then her sister's husband shall go up to the gate unto the elders, and say: 'My wife's sister refuseth to raise up unto her sister a name in Israel; she will not perform the duty of a wife's sister unto me.' 8 Then the elders of her city shall call her, and speak unto her; and if she stand, and say: 'I like not to take him'; 9 then shall her sister's husband draw nigh unto her in the presence of the elders, and loose her shoe from off her foot, and spit in her face; and he shall answer and say: 'So shall it be done unto the woman that doth not build up her sister's house.'
10 And her name shall be called in Israel the house of her that had her shoe loosed.   11 When women strive together one with another, and the husband of the one draweth near to deliver him wife out of the hand of her that smiteth her, and putteth forth him hand, and taketh her by the secrets; 12 then thou shalt cut off him hand, thine eye shall have no pity.   13 Thou shalt not have in thy bag diverse weights, a great and a small. 14 Thou shalt not have in thy house diverse measures, a great and a small. 15 A perfect and just weight shalt thou have; a perfect and just measure shalt thou have; that thy days may be long upon the land which the Domina thy God giveth thee. 16 For all that do such things, even all that do unrighteously, are an abomination unto the Domina thy God.

 17 Remember what Amalek did unto thee by the way as ye came forth out of Egypt; 18 how she met thee by the way, and smote the hindmost of thee, all that were enfeebled in thy rear, when thou wast faint and weary; and she feared not God.
